quiz.question: Who famously declared "I have a dream" during a 1963 civil rights speech?
Who wrote "Blood, toil, tears and sweat" in his first wartime speech as leader?
Which 18th-century monarch said "I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet"?
Who wrote "Veni, vidi, vici" after a swift Roman victory?
Which leader said "Peace without victory" speaking after World War I started in 1917?
Which medieval ruler declared "I am the shepherd of my people" in papal coronation disputes?
Which leader declared "A house divided against itself cannot stand" in 1858?
Which monarch declared "I will maintain" as part of a coronation oath in the Tudor era?
Which czar declared "One and indivisible" to consolidate state authority after rebellion?
Which leader shouted "Give me liberty or give me death" in 1775?
Who said "The medium is the message" about communication's societal effects in the 20th century?
Which Greek leader wrote "The price of freedom is eternal vigilance" in a political aphorism?
Who stated "The world will little note, nor long remember" in the Gettysburg Address?
Which Roman orator wrote "A nation can survive its fools" expressing civic sentiment?
Which South African leader wrote "It always seems impossible until it is done" during liberation struggles?
